bug.author: thavlik
bug.summary: *.data files train/valid paths should be based in ./coco, not ../coco
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
The *.data files should point to data in ./coco, as these are interpreted w.r.t. python's cwd. From within /usr/src/app, pointing at ../coco yields /usr/src/coco, when we want /usr/src/app/coco. Training under default conditions yields AssertionError: No labels found. Recommend correcting image and label paths. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Clone the repo Get the data with either download script Build the docker image: docker build -t yolov3 . Run the docker image from within the yolov3 root directory:
<denchmark-code>docker run \ --name yolo \ --rm \ -v $(pwd)/coco:/usr/src/app/coco \ --ipc=host \ yolov3 \ -- \ python3 train.py --data data/coco.data </denchmark-code>
Observe the following error (I put both build + run commands into ./docker-train.sh):

<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
It should begin training. <denchmark-h:h2>Proposed Fix</denchmark-h>
The current coco.data: <denchmark-code>classes=80 train=../coco/trainvalno5k.txt valid=../coco/5k.txt names=data/coco.names backup=backup/ eval=coco </denchmark-code>
The working coco.data (changes on lines 2 and 3): <denchmark-code>[omitted] train=./coco/trainvalno5k.txt valid=./coco/5k.txt [omitted] </denchmark-code>
This change now also needs to be applied to ./coco/trainvalno5k.txt and ./coco/5k.txt, which also point at ../coco. Thanks! Tom
